page.title: 05Fifield,Berkshire.
page.content: Fifield is a{small village.}Its name means 5 fields.Three roads form a triangle round the village-Fifield Road,Forest Green Road and Coningsby Lane.There are some old houses, among them Tudor Yew Tree Cottage and Grove Farm which is a Queen Anne house with a bricked up window.Fifield House was mentioned in 1591 but the building is not the original one.There are some pre-war Council houses in Fifield Road and post-war ones in Meadow Way.There is a small modern estate near the only two shops in the village.One shop is a newsagents,the other a general store and post office.There were no shops before 1955.The Hare and Hounds and the White Hart are the village's two public houses.Braywood Memorial Hall was built after the First World War and is used regularly by the villagers for various activities.
